intro: Spermacoce velascoana, commonly known as the velvet bindweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, velvety stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce velascoana is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain environments.
